com.google.android.glass.TMM

Class TMMCard

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.android.glass.TMM.TMMCard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<TMMCard>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AudioCard, TextCard, VideoCard

    public abstract class TMMCard
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<TMMCard>, java.io.Serializable
    The Class TMMCard. This abstract class must be extended by all types of cards used in this application. It contains the minimum amount of interaction required for a card to function in the application.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public static final java.lang.String VIDEO
        The Constant VIDEO. Used for the JSON parsing of cards.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • jsontype

        private final java.lang.String jsontype
        The specific type of the card, required when recreating card objects from JSON in HTTP responses. Can take 1 of 3 values: TEXT, AUDIO, and VIDEO.

      • TAG

        public static final java.lang.String TAG
        The Constant TAG. Used in the debug Logger

      • priority

        private int priority
        The priority of the card. This allows the user to order the cards in the list used to select the card of interest.

      • title

        private java.lang.String title
        The card's title. This is displayed prominently and is usually the largest text on the card. For best visibility, this should be less than 20 characters long.

      • uuid

        private java.lang.String uuid
        The database identifier of the card.

      • source

        private Server source
        The source, A Server object with info about where this card came from

    • Constructor Detail

      • TMMCard

        public TMMCard(java.lang.String uuid,
               int priority,
               java.lang.String cardTitle,
               Server source,
               java.lang.String type)
        Instantiates a new TMM card if the UUID is known used when creating cards from DB query results.
        Parameters:
        uuid - The unique UUID of the card. This must be obtained from the DB that this card resides on.
        priority - The priority of the card. This is used to order the cards in the SelectCardActivity, with higher priority cards located at the beginning of the sequence (position 0)
        cardTitle - The card's title. This is displayed prominently and is usually the largest text on the card. For best visibility, this should be less than 20 characters long.
        source - Information about the Server that this card originated from.
        type - The type of the card, either AUDIO, VIDEO, or TEXT

      • TMMCard

        public TMMCard(int priority,
               java.lang.String cardTitle,
               Server source,
               java.lang.String type)
        Instantiates a new TMM card, without setting the UUID of the card. Used when new card objects are created from scratch.
        Parameters:
        priority - The priority of the card. This is used to order the cards in the SelectCardActivity, with higher priority cards located at the beginning of the sequence (position 0)
        cardTitle - The card's title. This is displayed prominently and is usually the largest text on the card. For best visibility, this should be less than 20 characters long.
        source - Information about the Server that this card originated from.
        type - The type of the card, either AUDIO, VIDEO, or TEXT

    • Method Detail

      • getuuId

        public java.lang.String getuuId()
        Gets the uuid of the card. This can be used to directly reference the card in the DB.
        Returns:
        The String UUID of the card.

      • setuuId

        public void setuuId(java.lang.String id)
        Sets the uuid of the card. This must be obtained from the DB that this card resides on.
        Parameters:
        id - The new UUID of the card.

        public int getPriority()
        Gets the priority of the card.
        Returns:

        public void setPriority(int priority)
        Sets the priority. This is used to order the cards in the SelectCardActivity, with higher priority cards located at the beginning of the sequence (postion 0)
        Parameters:
        priority - The new priority of the card.

        Sets the title. This is displayed prominently and is usually the largest text on the card. For best visibility, this should be less than 20 characters long.
        Parameters:

      • getSource

        public Server getSource()
        Gets the source of this card as a Server object. This object contains information about the server that this card originated from.
        Returns:
        A Server object containing information about the source of this card.

      • setSource

        public void setSource(Server source)
        Sets the source object. This object contains information about the server that this audio card originated from.
        Parameters:
        source - The new Server object to set as the card's source.

      • getJsontype

        public java.lang.String getJsontype()
        Gets the JSON type of this card. Used in the translation of this card to/from JSON.
        Returns:
        THe type of this card - either TEXT, AUDIO, or VIDEO.
